text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition SatuSehatEncounter

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Encounter 0..*EncounterAn interaction during which services are provided to the patient
identifier 0..*IdentifierIdentifier(s) by which this encounter is known
status 1..1codeplanned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +
statusHistory
status 1..1codeplanned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +
period 1..1PeriodThe time that the episode was in the specified status
class 1..1CodingClassification of patient encounter
classHistory
class 1..1Codinginpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +
period 1..1PeriodThe time that the episode was in the specified class
type 0..*CodeableConceptSpecific type of encounter
serviceType 0..1CodeableConceptSpecific type of service
priority 0..1CodeableConceptIndicates the urgency of the encounter
subject 1..1Reference(Patient | Group)The patient or group present at the encounter
episodeOfCare 0..*Reference(EpisodeOfCare)Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against
basedOn 0..*Reference(ServiceRequest)The ServiceRequest that initiated this encounter
participant
type 0..*CodeableConceptRole of participant in encounter
individual 0..1Reference(Practitioner | PractitionerRole | RelatedPerson)Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient
period 0..1PeriodThe start and end time of the encounter
length 0..1DurationQuantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
reasonCode 0..*CodeableConceptCoded reason the encounter takes place
reasonReference 0..*Reference(Condition | Procedure | Observation | ImmunizationRecommendation)Reason the encounter takes place (reference)
diagnosis
condition 1..1Reference(Condition | Procedure)The diagnosis or procedure relevant to the encounter
use 0..1CodeableConceptRole that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge )
rank 0..1positiveIntRanking of the diagnosis (for each role type)
account 0..*Reference(Account)The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter
hospitalization
preAdmissionIdentifier 0..1IdentifierPre-admission identifier
origin 0..1Reference(Location | Organization)The location/organization from which the patient came before admission
admitSource 0..1CodeableConceptFrom where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer)
reAdmission 0..1CodeableConceptThe type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission
dietPreference 0..*CodeableConceptDiet preferences reported by the patient
specialArrangement 0..*CodeableConceptWheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc.
destination 0..1Reference(Location | Organization)Location/organization to which the patient is discharged
dischargeDisposition 0..1CodeableConceptCategory or kind of location after discharge
location
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
extension:serviceClass 0..1CodeableConceptService Class
URL: https://fhir.kemkes.go.id/r4/StructureDefinition/ServiceClass
location 1..1Reference(Location)Location the encounter takes place
period 1..1PeriodTime period during which the patient was present at the location
serviceProvider 0..1Reference(Organization)The organization (facility) responsible for this encounter
partOf 0..1Reference(Encounter)Another Encounter this encounter is part of

Documentation for this format

name: SatuSehatEncounter
title: Satu Sehat Encounter
description: Defines the ID Core constraints and extensions on the Encounter resource for the minimal set of data to query and retrieve encounter information.

element.short: An interaction during which services are provided to the patient
element.definition: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih daftar data mengenai informasi terkait kode atau nomor kunjungan yang dimiliki oleh lokasi induk yang setiap datanya direpresentasikan dengan tipe data Identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +
element.definition: Berisi data status tahapan dari pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi EncounterStatus.
element.comment: Note that internal business rules will determine the appropriate transitions that may occur between statuses (and also classes).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

mapping.map: No clear equivalent in HL7 v2; active/finished could be inferred from PV1-44, PV1-45, PV2-24; inactive could be inferred from PV2-16

element.short: List of past encounter statuses
element.definition: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.
element.comment: The current status is always found in the current version of the resource, not the status history.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data penyimpanan riwayat status dari kunjungan pasien dengan tipe data code. Terdapat 3 status yang wajib dikirimkan datanya yaitu arrived, In-progress, dan finished, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi EncounterStatus.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The time that the episode was in the specified status
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data penyimpanan waktu/log dari kunjungan pasien dengan tipe data Period.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Classification of patient encounter
element.definition: Berisi data klasifikasi dari pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data Coding, yang nilainya mengacu pada salah satu data terminologi dengan nama ActEncounterCode.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: List of past encounter classes
element.definition: The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.  This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transitions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kind of discharge from emergency to inpatient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +
element.definition: Berisi data penyimpanan riwayat klasifikasi dari kunjungan pasien dengan tipe data Coding, yang nilainya mengacu pada salah satu data terminologi dengan nama ActEncounterCode.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The time that the episode was in the specified class
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data klasifikasi kunjungan dengan tipe data Period.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Specific type of encounter
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data tipe spesifik dari kunjungan (contoh: konsultasi e-mail, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation) dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
element.comment: Since there are many ways to further classify encounters, this element is 0..*.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Specific type of service
element.definition: Berisi data tipe spesifik dari layanan yang diberikan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided.

element.short: Indicates the urgency of the encounter
element.definition: Berisi data indikasi urgensi dari kunjungan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

element.short: The patient or group present at the encounter
element.definition: Berisi data subjek dari pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Patient, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Patient/{patient-ihs-number}' Di mana isi dari parameter {patient-ihs-number} adalah ID Patient yang didapatkan dari master pasien indeks.
element.comment: While the encounter is always about the patient, the patient might not actually be known in all contexts of use, and there may be a group of patients that could be anonymous (such as in a group therapy for Alcoholics Anonymous - where the recording of the encounter could be used for billing on the number of people/staff and not important to the context of the specific patients) or alternately in veterinary care a herd of sheep receiving treatment (where the animals are not individually tracked).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Episode(s) of care that this encounter should be recorded against
element.definition: Berisi data informasi episode perawatan yang dilakukan pada kunjungan ini dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource EpisodeOfCare, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'EpisodeOfCare/{id-resource-EpisodeOfCare}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-EpisodeOfCare} adalah ID EpisodeOfCare yang didapatkan dari server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The ServiceRequest that initiated this encounter
element.definition: Berisi data permintaan yang mendasari kunjungan ini. Misalnya, kunjungan didasari oleh permintaan rujukan menggunakan resource ServiceRequest dengan tipe data Reference, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'ServiceRequest/{id-resource-ServiceRequest}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-ServiceRequest} adalah ID ServiceRequest yang didapatkan dari server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: List of participants involved in the encounter
element.definition: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Role of participant in encounter
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data partisipan pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
element.comment: The participant type indicates how an individual participates in an encounter. It includes non-practitioner participants, and for practitioners this is to describe the action type in the context of this encounter (e.g. Admitting Dr, Attending Dr, Translator, Consulting Dr). This is different to the practitioner roles which are functional roles, derived from terms of employment, education, licensing, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Period of time during the encounter that the participant participated
element.definition: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient
element.definition: Berisi data partisipan dari pertemuan, diisikan dengan SATUSEHAT ID dokter/tenaga kesehatan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Practitioner/{practitioner-ihs-number}' Di mana isi dari parameter {practitioner-ihs-number} adalah ID Nakes organisasi induk yang didapatkan dari master Nakes indeks.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The appointment that scheduled this encounter
element.definition: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The start and end time of the encounter
element.definition: Berisi data waktu dari pertemuan dimulai sampai selesai (arrived to finished) dengan tipe data Period.
element.comment: If not (yet) known, the end of the Period may be omitted.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
element.definition: Berisi data jumlah waktu terjadinya kunjungan dengan tipe data Duration.
element.comment: May differ from the time the Encounter.period lasted because of leave of absence.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (PV1-45 less PV1-44) iff ( (PV1-44 not empty) and (PV1-45 not empty) ); units in minutes

element.short: Coded reason the encounter takes place
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data kode alasan terjadinya kunjungan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
element.comment: For systems that need to know which was the primary diagnosis, these will be marked with the standard extension primaryDiagnosis (which is a sequence value rather than a flag, 1 = primary diagnosis).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Reason why the encounter takes place.

mapping.map: EVN-4 / PV2-3 (note: PV2-3 is nominally constrained to inpatient admissions; HL7 v2 makes no vocabulary suggestions for PV2-3; would not expect PV2 segment or PV2-3 to be in use in all implementations )

element.short: Reason the encounter takes place (reference)
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data alasan yang mendasari terjadinya kunjungan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition | Procedure | Observation | ImmunizationRecommendation, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Condition/{id-condition}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-condition} adalah ID Condition yang didapatkan dari hasil response.
element.comment: For systems that need to know which was the primary diagnosis, these will be marked with the standard extension primaryDiagnosis (which is a sequence value rather than a flag, 1 = primary diagnosis).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: EVN-4 / PV2-3 (note: PV2-3 is nominally constrained to inpatient admissions; HL7 v2 makes no vocabulary suggestions for PV2-3; would not expect PV2 segment or PV2-3 to be in use in all implementations )

element.short: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter
element.definition: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: The diagnosis or procedure relevant to the encounter
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data diagnosis dari pasien. Diagnosa bisa berupa diagnosa awal dan/atau pulang dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition | Procedure. Condition dalam diagnosa dapat dicatat lebih dari 1. Nilainya memiliki format: 'Condition/{id-resource-Condition}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Condition} adalah ID Condition yang didapatkan dari server.
element.comment: For systems that need to know which was the primary diagnosis, these will be marked with the standard extension primaryDiagnosis (which is a sequence value rather than a flag, 1 = primary diagnosis).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Resources that would commonly referenced at Encounter.indication would be Condition and/or Procedure. These most closely align with DG1/PRB and PR1 respectively.

element.short: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge )
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data penggunaan kode untuk mendeskripsikan jenis diagnosa dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The type of diagnosis this condition represents.

element.short: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type)
element.definition: Jika ada lebih dari 1 kondisi, maka gunakan elemen rank untuk mengurutkan mana diagnosa yang lebih utama. Semakin kecil angkanya, maka semakin utama, dengan tipe data positiveInt.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data akun yang digunakan untuk penagihan/billing untuk pertemuan ini dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Account, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Account/{id-account}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-account} adalah ID Account yang didapatkan dari hasil response.
element.comment: The billing system may choose to allocate billable items associated with the Encounter to different referenced Accounts based on internal business rules.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Details about the admission to a healthcare service
element.definition: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.
element.comment: An Encounter may cover more than just the inpatient stay. Contexts such as outpatients, community clinics, and aged care facilities are also included.The duration recorded in the period of this encounter covers the entire scope of this hospitalization record.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Pre-admission identifier
element.definition: Berisi data pre-admisi dengan tipe data Identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The location/organization from which the patient came before admission
element.definition: Berisi data lokasi atau organisasi asal pasien sebelum terjadi admisi dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Location | Organization, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Location/{id-resource-Location}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Location} adalah ID Location yang didapatkan dari server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer)
element.definition: Berisi data asal di mana sebelum pasien dirawat/admisia dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: From where the patient was admitted.

element.short: The type of hospital re-admission that has occurred (if any). If the value is absent, then this is not identified as a readmission
element.definition: Berisi data tipe readmisi yang terjadi (bila ada). Bila elemen ini kosong, maka kunjungan tidak dianggap sebagai readmisi dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The reason for re-admission of this hospitalization encounter.

element.short: Diet preferences reported by the patient
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data preferensi diet yang dilaporkan oleh pasien dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
element.comment: For example, a patient may request both a dairy-free and nut-free diet preference (not mutually exclusive).
element.requirements: Used to track patient's diet restrictions and/or preference. For a complete description of the nutrition needs of a patient during their stay, one should use the nutritionOrder resource which links to Encounter.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Medical, cultural or ethical food preferences to help with catering requirements.

element.short: Special courtesies (VIP, board member)
element.definition: Special courtesies (VIP, board member).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Wheelchair, translator, stretcher, etc.
element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih data permintaan khusus yang dibuat untuk kunjungan rawat inap ini seperti penyediaan peralatan khusus dan lain-lain dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Location/organization to which the patient is discharged
element.definition: Berisi data lokasi atau organisasi tempat pasien dipulangkan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Location | Organization, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Location/{id-resource-Location}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Location} adalah ID Location yang didapatkan dari server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Category or kind of location after discharge
element.definition: Berisi data kategori atau tipe lokasi setelah pasien dipulangkan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: List of locations where the patient has been
element.definition: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.
element.comment: Virtual encounters can be recorded in the Encounter by specifying a location reference to a location of type "kind" such as "client's home" and an encounter.class = "virtual".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Service Class
element.definition: Extension for service class information.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Location the encounter takes place
element.definition: Berisi data lokasi dari pertemuan pasien. Dapat diisi oleh ruangan periksa pasien / poli pemeriksaannya dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Location, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Location/{id-resource-Location}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Location} adalah ID Location yang didapatkan dari server.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: planned | active | reserved | completed
element.definition: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.
element.comment: When the patient is no longer active at a location, then the period end date is entered, and the status may be changed to completed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierachy - bed room ward etc.)
element.definition: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.
element.comment:
This information is de-normalized from the Location resource to support the easier understanding of the encounter resource and processing in messaging or query.

There may be many levels in the hierachy, and this may only pic specific levels that are required for a specific usage scenario.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Time period during which the patient was present at the location
element.definition: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The organization (facility) responsible for this encounter
element.definition: Berisi data organisasi pengelola lokasi dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Organization/{organization-ihs-number}' Di mana isi dari parameter {organization-ihs-number} adalah ID organisasi induk yang didapatkan dari master sarana indeks.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Another Encounter this encounter is part of
element.definition: Berisi data kunjungan di mana kunjungan ini menjadi bagiannya (secara administratif atau dalam waktu) dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Encounter, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Encounter/{id-encounter}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-encounter} adalah ID Encounter yang didapatkan dari hasil response.
element.comment: This is also used for associating a child's encounter back to the mother's encounter.Refer to the Notes section in the Patient resource for further details.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih daftar data mengenai informasi terkait kode atau nomor kunjungan yang dimiliki oleh lokasi induk yang setiap datanya direpresentasikan dengan tipe data Identifier.
Berisi data status tahapan dari pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi EncounterStatus.

Berisi satu atau lebih data penyimpanan riwayat status dari kunjungan pasien dengan tipe data code. Terdapat 3 status yang wajib dikirimkan datanya yaitu arrived, In-progress, dan finished, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi EncounterStatus.
Berisi satu atau lebih data penyimpanan waktu/log dari kunjungan pasien dengan tipe data Period.
Berisi data klasifikasi dari pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data Coding, yang nilainya mengacu pada salah satu data terminologi dengan nama ActEncounterCode.
Berisi data penyimpanan riwayat klasifikasi dari kunjungan pasien dengan tipe data Coding, yang nilainya mengacu pada salah satu data terminologi dengan nama ActEncounterCode.
Berisi satu atau lebih data klasifikasi kunjungan dengan tipe data Period.
Berisi satu atau lebih data tipe spesifik dari kunjungan (contoh: konsultasi e-mail, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation) dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data tipe spesifik dari layanan yang diberikan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data indikasi urgensi dari kunjungan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi data subjek dari pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Patient, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Patient/{patient-ihs-number}' Di mana isi dari parameter {patient-ihs-number} adalah ID Patient yang didapatkan dari master pasien indeks.

Berisi data informasi episode perawatan yang dilakukan pada kunjungan ini dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource EpisodeOfCare, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'EpisodeOfCare/{id-resource-EpisodeOfCare}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-EpisodeOfCare} adalah ID EpisodeOfCare yang didapatkan dari server.

Berisi data permintaan yang mendasari kunjungan ini. Misalnya, kunjungan didasari oleh permintaan rujukan menggunakan resource ServiceRequest dengan tipe data Reference, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'ServiceRequest/{id-resource-ServiceRequest}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-ServiceRequest} adalah ID ServiceRequest yang didapatkan dari server.
Berisi satu atau lebih data partisipan pertemuan pasien dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi data partisipan dari pertemuan, diisikan dengan SATUSEHAT ID dokter/tenaga kesehatan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Practitioner/{practitioner-ihs-number}' Di mana isi dari parameter {practitioner-ihs-number} adalah ID Nakes organisasi induk yang didapatkan dari master Nakes indeks.
Berisi data waktu dari pertemuan dimulai sampai selesai (arrived to finished) dengan tipe data Period.
Berisi data jumlah waktu terjadinya kunjungan dengan tipe data Duration.
Berisi satu atau lebih data kode alasan terjadinya kunjungan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi satu atau lebih data alasan yang mendasari terjadinya kunjungan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition | Procedure | Observation | ImmunizationRecommendation, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Condition/{id-condition}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-condition} adalah ID Condition yang didapatkan dari hasil response.

Berisi satu atau lebih data diagnosis dari pasien. Diagnosa bisa berupa diagnosa awal dan/atau pulang dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition | Procedure. Condition dalam diagnosa dapat dicatat lebih dari 1. Nilainya memiliki format: 'Condition/{id-resource-Condition}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Condition} adalah ID Condition yang didapatkan dari server.
Berisi satu atau lebih data penggunaan kode untuk mendeskripsikan jenis diagnosa dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Jika ada lebih dari 1 kondisi, maka gunakan elemen rank untuk mengurutkan mana diagnosa yang lebih utama. Semakin kecil angkanya, maka semakin utama, dengan tipe data positiveInt.

Berisi satu atau lebih data akun yang digunakan untuk penagihan/billing untuk pertemuan ini dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Account, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Account/{id-account}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-account} adalah ID Account yang didapatkan dari hasil response.
Berisi data pre-admisi dengan tipe data Identifier.

Berisi data lokasi atau organisasi asal pasien sebelum terjadi admisi dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Location | Organization, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Location/{id-resource-Location}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Location} adalah ID Location yang didapatkan dari server.
Berisi data asal di mana sebelum pasien dirawat/admisia dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data tipe readmisi yang terjadi (bila ada). Bila elemen ini kosong, maka kunjungan tidak dianggap sebagai readmisi dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi satu atau lebih data preferensi diet yang dilaporkan oleh pasien dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi satu atau lebih data permintaan khusus yang dibuat untuk kunjungan rawat inap ini seperti penyediaan peralatan khusus dan lain-lain dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi data lokasi atau organisasi tempat pasien dipulangkan dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Location | Organization, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Location/{id-resource-Location}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Location} adalah ID Location yang didapatkan dari server.
Berisi data kategori atau tipe lokasi setelah pasien dipulangkan dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi data lokasi dari pertemuan pasien. Dapat diisi oleh ruangan periksa pasien / poli pemeriksaannya dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Location, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Location/{id-resource-Location}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Location} adalah ID Location yang didapatkan dari server.

Berisi data organisasi pengelola lokasi dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Organization, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Organization/{organization-ihs-number}' Di mana isi dari parameter {organization-ihs-number} adalah ID organisasi induk yang didapatkan dari master sarana indeks.

Berisi data kunjungan di mana kunjungan ini menjadi bagiannya (secara administratif atau dalam waktu) dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Encounter, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Encounter/{id-encounter}' Di mana isi dari parameter {id-encounter} adalah ID Encounter yang didapatkan dari hasil response.
